item.title: about Steve
item.description: I’m passionate about complex systems, strategy, technology and society. I help organisations improve their situational awareness and decide what to do, often with the aid of Wardley Maps. I also help make software delivery teams better. I speak at events on occasion, and publish free talks on Slideshare. I’m an advocate of Open Source Software and former Perl contributor. When I’m not working I’m either busy being a parent, exploring the outdoors, or trying to avoid rebuilding another house.

item.title: Asteroids with HTML5
item.description: If you’re here for the hacked up asteroids-esque space shooter to try out HTML5’s canvas element, you’ll find it at /asteroids/. You may also be interested in the slides from the Ottawa JavaScript Meetup: Writing a Space Shooter with HTML5 Canvas (PDF, 2012) The code is freely available: /spurkis/asteroids

item.title: Visual unit test results
item.description: TAP::Formatter::HTML is a plugin for the test automation framework, TAP::Harness. It was written to highlight visually where & why your test suite is breaking. Here are some examples: test-output.html DBD-SQLite-example.html Template-example.html The code is freely available: /spurkis/TAP-Formatter-HTML
